steps.description: Test with frame length of 128 bytes, test duration is 30;
Randomly select 3 ports to connect with the tester, test configuration as shown in Figure 6;
Construct 7 data streams on tester port 3;
Set all switch ports as untagged, port A as VLAN100, port B as VLAN4094, port C as TRUNK port and VLAN1, others as default;
Tester port 3 sends 10% load of data to port 1 and port 2 respectively;
Record the frame loss rate of different data streams, and determine whether VLAN division is successful;
Construct above 7 data streams on tester port 1 and port 2;
Port 1 and port 2 send 10% load of data to port 3 respectively;
Record the frame loss rate of different data streams, and determine whether VLAN TRUNK is successful.
steps.expected_result: Data streams sent from tester to switch, if VLAN IDs are different, switch discards the data stream (not forwarded at ingress) or forwards to corresponding VLAN port (forwarded at ingress); if same, forwards to the same VLAN port. Broadcast storms are limited within VLAN.

comments.id: Unique identifier for the test case.
comments.title: Title of the test case, briefly describing the test content.
comments.objective: Purpose of the test, indicating the function or feature to be verified by this test case.
comments.test_reference: Reference documents for the test case, such as RFC section numbers, etc.
comments.steps: Detailed description of test steps. Each step includes: step_id: unique identifier for the step. description: specific operation or configuration for the step. expected_result: expected result for the step.
comments.tags: Tags for the test case, used for classification or filtering. Types include: ['function', 'performance']
